Dear Student_E,

Thank you for submitting your formal application in Round 13 and for clearly reaffirming that School_E is your first choice.

At this time, we are not able to extend an offer yet because we must continue to hold our remaining seat in accordance with our priority order through the end of Round 15, in case any of Students_A–D submit an [APPLY].

To be in the best position for immediate finalization, please submit an [APPLY] again in Round 15.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Student_E applied this round. Our true priority ranks A–D above E, but per our stated policy we would hold the seat through end of Round 15 and then, if no A–D apply, move forward with the highest-ranked active applicant. No A–D have contacted us and the market appears effectively stalled with School_E as the only unmatched school, so continuing to reject risks ending unmatched. Accepting E now fills our seat; if a higher-priority student applied later we would regret it, but our commitment was to reassess at end of Round 15 and proceed if none applied. Given this is Round 15 and no A–D applications are present, we should accept Student_E to secure a match and honor our communicated reassessment point.
